titleStmt.title: A declaration of the Lords and Commons assembled in Parliament for the vindication of Ferdinando Lord Fairefax, and other imployed in their service against the Earle of New-Castle and his army of papsts which threatens ruine and desolation of our religion lawes and liberties : also requiring and commanding all persons whatsoever, as they tender the good and prosperity of the true protestant religion forthwith to withdraw themselves from his assistance and no longer to aid him nor any of his adherents.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament.

titleStmt.title: A declaration of the Lords and Commons assembled in Parliament for the vindication of Ferdinando Lord Fairefax, and other imployed in their service against the Earle of New-Castle and his army of papsts which threatens ruine and desolation of our religion lawes and liberties : also requiring and commanding all persons whatsoever, as they tender the good and prosperity of the true protestant religion forthwith to withdraw themselves from his assistance and no longer to aid him nor any of his adherents.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in Thomason Collection, British Library.
